A Psalm of David. Give unto the LORD, O ye mighty, give unto the LORD glory and strength.<RF>ye mighty: Heb. ye sons of the mighty<Rf>
Give unto the LORD the glory due unto his name; worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness.<RF>the glory…: Heb. the honour of his name<Rf><RF>in…: or, in his glorious sanctuary<Rf>
The voice of the LORD <FI>is<Fi> upon the waters: the God of glory thundereth: the LORD <FI>is<Fi> upon many waters.<RF>many: or, great<Rf>
The voice of the LORD <FI>is<Fi> powerful; the voice of the LORD <FI>is<Fi> full of majesty.<RF>powerful: Heb. in power<Rf><RF>full…: Heb. in majesty<Rf>
The voice of the LORD breaketh the cedars; yea, the LORD breaketh the cedars of Lebanon.
He maketh them also to skip like a calf; Lebanon and Sirion like a young unicorn.
The voice of the LORD divideth the flames of fire.<RF>divideth: Heb. cutteth out<Rf>
The voice of the LORD shaketh the wilderness; the LORD shaketh the wilderness of Kadesh.

The voice of the LORD maketh the hinds to calve, and discovereth the forests: and in his temple doth every one speak of <FI>his<Fi> glory.<RF>to calve: or, to be in pain<Rf><RF>doth…: or, every whit of it uttereth, etc<Rf>
The LORD sitteth upon the flood; yea, the LORD sitteth King for ever.
The LORD will give strength unto his people; the LORD will bless his people with peace.<CM>
